New Records: India's 2/3 is the lowest score at the fall of third wicket from which any team went on to win in men's ODIs.
Key Match Events: KL Rahul scored an unbeaten 97 off 115 balls.
Ravindra Jadeja took 3 wickets for 28 runs.
Jasprit Bumrah took 2 wickets for 35 runs.
Josh Hazlewood took 3 wickets for 38 runs.
Mitchell Starc took 1 wicket for 31 runs.
India won by 6 wickets with 52 balls remaining.
India's pursuit of a modest target began with a historically bad start at 2/3.
KL Rahul and Virat Kohli created a match-winning partnership under high pressure.
KL Rahul finished the game with a six, ending on 97 not out.
Post-Match Reflections: Winning captain Rohit Sharma praised the team's fielding and bowling efforts and acknowledged the challenge of adapting to different conditions in future matches.
Losing captain Pat Cummins reflected on the challenges of defending a low score and the need for the team to review their performance.
KL Rahul expressed his happiness in contributing to the team's win and shared his experience of batting under pressure.
Rohit Sharma mentioned that the team stood up to the challenge of a '10 for 3' situation, which he had previously emphasized as a preparation strategy.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at MA Chidambaram Stadium, Chepauk, Chennai.
The game was part of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023.
KL Rahul was named Player of the Match.
The match was a day-night 50-over game.
